name: Substrate exposure during low flow
functionStatement: Ensures habitat availability and water quality during low water levels, and indicates non-storm conditions experienced the majority of the time.
descriptionMarkdown: Evaluates whether the reach maintains adequate wetted depth and continuity during low flow by integrating pool depth, wetted length, exposed bed, and Q90/Q10 differences.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Estimate percent of bed exposed during low flow using field photos or dry-season imagery where available.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Minimal bed exposure (<25%), or dryness is normal for the stream type.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: >75% exposed, or dryness in a historically perennial reach.

references: LiDAR with estimated low-flow water surface (where available).
